definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: Park visitors in Beijing will be frisked at 10 parks to avoid possible safety risk.
sentences.chinese: 北京10大公园将于近日起进行入园安检，以备不测。

sentences.english: In the long run, one should save money for emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 从长远看，应该存钱以备不测。

definition: a possible period of want or need
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
variant of 伺機|伺机[si4 ji1]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
